Talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:SurpriseS_01>That's incredible! C-could you give
us a demonstration?
Talk_0048:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>See how the vehicle on the <clr:0000>round
pedestal<clr:ffff> is missing a wheel?
Fix it, please.
Talk_0050:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Just use your fancy <clr:0000>ancient power<clr:ffff>! Do I
have to beg?
Talk_0051:
Now it's time for the main event...<sp:5:0:0>the one
in pieces on the <clr:0000>square pedestal<clr:ffff>!

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS_01>Use that new <clr:0000>power<clr:ffff> of yours,<sp:5:0:0> and fix it up
lickety-split.
Talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_01>Conferring <clr:0000>Autobuild<clr:ffff> to authorizer now.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>Please utilize it as you explore and
excavate the Depths for zonaite.
Talk_0055:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL>Use your new <clr:0000>power<clr:ffff> to fix our vehicles!<sp:5:0:0>
If you need more details...<sp:5:0:0>go ask her.
Talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseL_01>Did I...<sp:5:0:0>see what I thought I saw?


Did that thing just...<sp:5:0:0>give you the <clr:0000>power<clr:ffff>
we've been researching?
Talk_0039:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>The text claims that power can <clr:0000>reproduce<clr:ffff>
anything you've built.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>And that would mean...<sp:5:0:0>you could fix our
vehicles in the blink of an eye!
Talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Let me see what the <clr:0000>text<clr:ffff> has to say.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>Hold on, um...


"This ability will allow you to <clr:0000>commit any
structure you create to memory<clr:ffff>.

"Any object committed to memory <clr:0000>can be
instantly reproduced<clr:ffff>."
Talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>I know just what to use it on!<sp:5:0:0>


As luck would have it, <clr:0000>both of our vehicles
just broke<clr:ffff>, <sp:5:0:0>and we've been struggling to
put them back together again.
Talk_0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>The vehicles we used to get here
are broken.

The vehicle on the <clr:0000>round pedestal<clr:ffff> is only
missing a <clr:0000>wheel<clr:ffff>, so it should be a fairly
easy fix...
Conversely, the one on the <clr:0000>square
pedestal <clr:ffff>was broken to pieces.<sp:5:0:0> It
would take a long time to repair.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But with your power, after you <clr:0000>put the
wheel back on the first one<clr:ffff>, you should
be able to <clr:0000>fix the second<clr:ffff> in a blink!
Talk_0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Start over! Hurry up and fix the <clr:0000>wheel<clr:ffff>
on that one! On the <clr:0000>round pedestal<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0041: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Link. I have something else to give you.
Talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hands off! If you want to tinker with
something, then come take a look at
this <clr:0000>weird stone statue<clr:ffff> instead!
Talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>And the one on the <clr:0000>square pedestal<clr:ffff>
has fallen to pieces.

But I think,<sp:5:0:0> if you put the wheel back onto
<clr:0000>the first one<clr:ffff>...

You should be able use your power to
<clr:0000>repair the second<clr:ffff> in no time flat!
Talk_0042:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hang on just a minute! Are you gonna fix
our vehicles for us or not?!

And isn't one special <clr:0000>power<clr:ffff> enough? How
greedy can you be?! That's so unfai—

<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice_01>Ahem, excuse me, I lost my
composure there...

<sp:3:0:2:0701>W-we are really in a bind, you know.
Could you please use your <clr:0000>power<clr:ffff> so
we can go home?
Talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughL_01>So come on, let's see it in action!
Fix 'em up quick!
Talk_0043:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>Wow, look at that! <sp:5:0:0>That wheel's right back
on there, snug as a bug!
Talk_0045:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL_01>Whoa. It's like I'm seeing double!<sp:0:4:0>Built in less than no time flat too.<sp:5:0:0> This is
exactly what I was hoping for. Thank you,
<clr:0000>ancient power<clr:ffff>!
Talk_0011:
You can start by repairing the one
on the <clr:0000>round pedestal<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Use that new<clr:0000> power<clr:ffff> already! Come on,
snappy-snappy, fixy-fixy!
